title: Assignments for 431 in Fall 2024
text:
This page links to all instructions and other information about course assignments. All deadlines are found on the Course Calendar.






This page is under construction. Trust nothing at this stage.



We aim to post most class materials for 431 in Fall 2024 before 2024-08-13.
Some materials will be posted sooner, but don’t take those drafts seriously.




The general page for all 431 Labs is here. We’ll post links to each specific lab page below as they become available.

title: Course Calendar
text:
This page is under construction. Trust nothing at this stage.



We aim to post most class materials for 431 in Fall 2024 before 2024-08-13.
Some materials will be posted sooner, but don’t take those drafts seriously.


All class sessions will be held from 1:00 to 2:15 PM in Room E321-323 on the third floor of the Robbins building at CWRU’s School of Medicine.
Readings come from:

Spiegelhalter: David Spiegelhalter’s The Art of Statistics: How to Learn from Data originally published in 2020 and available at all major book retailers.
R4DS: R for Data Science (2nd edition), found at https://r4ds.hadley.nz/.

title: 431 Course Main Page: Fall 2024
text:
431 is the first part of a two-semester sequence (with 432) in applied statistics and data science taught by Professor Thomas Love in the Department of Population and Quantitative Health Sciences at Case Western Reserve University.






This page is under construction. Trust nothing at this stage.



We aim to post most class materials for 431 in Fall 2024 before 2024-08-13.
Some materials will be posted sooner, but don’t take those drafts seriously.




Your first few steps in this course are to:

Register and enroll via the CWRU Student Information System (SIS).

Students will be permitted to register for the course starting in mid-July.

Obtain a copy of David Spiegelhalter’s The Art of Statistics: How to Learn from Data, originally published in 2020 and available at all major book retailers for less than $20.

More to come.



Materials that will appear here include:

the course syllabus
the course calendar, which will provide the final word on all deadlines, and will also link to all materials used in each class session
Dr. Love’s course notes, which are a major source of course examples
detailed information on all course assignments, with all deadlines found in the calendar
information on software, including installation instructions for R, RStudio, and the key R packages and data sets we’ll use
and information on how to contact us.




Class will be held on Tuesdays and Thursdays from 1:00 - 2:15 PM in Room E321-E323 at CWRU’s School of Medicine, starting on 2024-08-27.



If you have any questions before class begins, contact Professor Love at thomas dot love at case dot edu.
Thank you.
